data.title: Josh/winrt inplace editbox
Fix deprecation warning caused by PageView::getPages()
data.body:
Hello, I'm getting this warning while compiling libcocos2d with GCC on Linux:

```
cocos/ui/UIPageView.cpp:332:46: warning: ‘cocos2d::Vector<cocos2d::ui::Layout*>& cocos2d::ui::PageView::getPages()’ is deprecated (declared at cocos/ui/UIPageView.cpp:316) [-Wdeprecated-declarations]
     if (index < 0 || index >= this->getPages().size())
                                              ^
```

Also getting the same warning when building on Windows:

```
3>..\ui\UIPageView.cpp(332): warning C4996: 'cocos2d::ui::PageView::getPages': was declared deprecated [cocos\2d\libcocos2d.vcxproj]
```

This pull request suppresses that deprecation warning and keeps backward compatibility with the v3.
Thanks!

data.title: fix: fix issue 15423 for v3.11
data.body: Github issue #15423

data.title: Problem while creating a cc.GLProgramm()
data.body:
So I encountered a problem while creating a cc.GLProgramm(). In the log there I found this:
`Uncaught TypeError: locGL.createProgram is not a function
cc.GLProgram.cc.Class.extend.initWithVertexShaderByteArray 
@ CCGLProgram.js:146cc.GLProgram.cc.Class.extend.initWithVertexShaderFilename 
@ CCGLProgram.js:200cc.Layer.extend.ctor @ layerBlur.js:7(anonymous function) 
@ CCClass.js:128Class 
@ CCClass.js:90cc.Scene.extend.onEnter 
@ menuScene.js:11(anonymous function) 
@ CCClass.js:128cc.Director.cc.Class.extend.setNextScene 
@ CCDirector.js:545cc.Director.cc.Class.extend.drawScene
...`
I did some debugging in the loaded Cocos-JS Library "CCGLProgramm.js" and obviously the function createProgramm is not defined in the Variable locGL, which is a reference to the glContext. Is this a real bug or is there any solution?

data.title: No exit from EditBox with InputMode::PHONE_NUMBER
data.body:
Tested on iPhone 5 and iPhone Touch 5G.
Using Cocos2d-x 3.9

Using modes DECIMAL, NUMERIC and PHONE_NUMBER there is no exit from edit box. Touching the background doesn't work.

![noexitfromageeditbox](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5878299/14668436/27c4180e-06dc-11e6-9a5b-b4aa193b3f44.png)

data.title: Copy polygonInfo when cloning SpriteFrame
data.body: Copy the `_polygonInfo` over in SpriteFrame's `clone()` function. Otherwise, for example, calling `reverse()` on an Animate action will incorrectly draw the the node that it is applied to.

data.title: [BugFixes]Several serious bug fixes related to network/asset_manager
data.body:
This PR includes several bug fixes related to network/asset_manager
### Downloader
#### storage path space bug (iOS) https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/963efe78fe5d6f1e76a95eb0a20783cbae55faa1

This is merged to v3 in https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/14843 but not in v3.11 branch yet.
#### thread safety (Android) https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/d848292860421ffd475b6482818060b501380955

This is related to [my previous fix](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/14530) for android downloader that is not thread safe which may crash the app in certain circumstances
### AssetManagerEx
#### If the last task fails, it will stuck at `UPDATING` forever https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/58586871619d08a2ef3b8829a6c8529929e82562

See https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/15463
#### performance improvement for manifest diff (this is not a bug) https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/f3cd1298af0f16d67f93d9be8bfbdd3f22ce2796
### HTTPAsyncConnection
#### Crash when custom SSL certificate is set(iOS) https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/200c9fda59f7a5fbece4ba4fa3a3729e38de6998

There is a redundant release of a CFArrayRef causing the object to be deallocated before NSURLConnectionLoader thread tries to release it, making it send a release message to an already deallocated object.
This also fixes a memory leak of SecCertificateRef
See https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/15464

data.title: [HttpAsynConnection]Crash if a custom SSL certificate is set
data.body:
## Problem

If a custom SSL certificate is set, the app will crash in NSURLConnectionLoader thread.
## Investigation

If we turn on Zombie Object, we will see a message like this

```
[CFArray release]: message sent to deallocated instance 0x167ba220
```

If we look into the malloc history, we will see something like this

```
0x00000001dc2a3fc0: malloc(    64) -> 0x1dc2a3fc0 _NSZombie_CFArray
stack[0]: addr = 0x1dc2a3fc0, type=malloc, frames:
     [0] 0x0000000117562391 libsystem_malloc.dylib`malloc_zone_malloc + 107
     [1] 0x000000011676c5a6 CoreFoundation`_CFRuntimeCreateInstance + 310
     [2] 0x000000011677fb80 CoreFoundation`__CFArrayInit + 224
     [3] 0x00000001167e5081 CoreFoundation`__CFArrayCreate0 + 33
     [4] 0x000000010f94dcc6 MyProject`-[HttpAsynConnection shouldTrustProtectionSpace:] + 230 at HttpAsynConnection-apple.m:177:16
     [5] 0x000000010f94de0d MyProject`-[HttpAsynConnection connection:willSendRequestForAuthenticationChallenge:] + 93 at HttpAsynConnection-apple.m:205:8
     [6] 0x0000000113c8fa88 CFNetwork`__65-[NSURLConnectionInternal _withConnectionAndDelegate:onlyActive:]_block_invoke + 69
     [7] 0x0000000113c8fa2c CFNetwork`-[NSURLConnectionInternal _withConnectionAndDelegate:onlyActive:] + 199
     [8] 0x0000000113c8fb81 CFNetwork`-[NSURLConnectionInternal _withActiveConnectionAndDelegate:] + 48
     [9] 0x0000000113c63cce CFNetwork`-[NSURLConnectionInternalConnection(Internal) sendCFChallenge:toSelector:] + 84
     [10] 0x0000000113b04b86 CFNetwork`___ZN27URLConnectionClient_Classic51_delegate_willSendRequestForAuthenticationChallengeEP19_CFURLAuthChallenge_block_invoke + 141
     [11] 0x0000000113beb965 CFNetwork`___ZN27URLConnectionClient_Classic18_withDelegateAsyncEPKcU13block_pointerFvP16_CFURLConnectionPK33CFURLConnectionClientCurrent_VMaxE_block_invoke_2 + 100
     [12] 0x000000011736a49b libdispatch.dylib`_dispatch_client_callout + 8
     [13] 0x000000011734c54b libdispatch.dylib`_dispatch_block_invoke + 716
     [14] 0x0000000113aea1ac CFNetwork`RunloopBlockContext::_invoke_block(void const*, void*) + 24
     [15] 0x00000001167afee4 CoreFoundation`CFArrayApplyFunction + 68
     [16] 0x0000000113aea0a5 CFNetwork`RunloopBlockContext::perform() + 137
     [17] 0x0000000113ae9f5e CFNetwork`MultiplexerSource::perform() + 282
     [18] 0x0000000113ae9d80 CFNetwork`MultiplexerSource::_perform(void*) + 72
     [19] 0x00000001167dca31 CoreFoundation`__CFRUNLOOP_IS_CALLING_OUT_TO_A_SOURCE0_PERFORM_FUNCTION__ + 17
     [20] 0x00000001167d295c CoreFoundation`__CFRunLoopDoSources0 + 556
     [21] 0x00000001167d1e13 CoreFoundation`__CFRunLoopRun + 867
     [22] 0x00000001167d1828 CoreFoundation`CFRunLoopRunSpecific + 488
     [23] 0x00000001134e02f1 Foundation`-[NSRunLoop(NSRunLoop) runMode:beforeDate:] + 267
     [24] 0x000000010ed15444 MyProject`cocos2d::network::processTask(cocos2d::network::HttpClient*, cocos2d::network::HttpRequest*, NSString*, void*, long*, void*, char*) + 6916 at HttpClient-apple.mm:229:9
     [25] 0x000000010ed1112b MyProject`cocos2d::network::HttpClient::processResponse(cocos2d::network::HttpResponse*, char*) + 283 at HttpClient-apple.mm:521:14
     [26] 0x000000010ed10c38 MyProject`cocos2d::network::HttpClient::networkThread() + 680 at HttpClient-apple.mm:77:9
     [27] 0x000000010ed20fe8 MyProject`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> > >(void*) [inlined] decltype(*(std::__1::forward<cocos2d::network::HttpClient*&>(fp0)).*fp(std::__1::forward<>(fp1))) std::__1::__invoke<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*&)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*&, void>(void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*&&&)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*&&&) + 134 at __functional_base:382:12
     [28] 0x000000010ed20f62 MyProject`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> > >(void*) [inlined] std::__1::__bind_return<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), std::__1::tuple<cocos2d::network::HttpClient*>, std::__1::tuple<>, _is_valid_bind_return<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), std::__1::tuple<cocos2d::network::HttpClient*>, std::__1::tuple<> >::value>::type std::__1::__apply_functor<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), std::__1::tuple<cocos2d::network::HttpClient*>, 0ul, std::__1::tuple<> >(void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*&)(), std::__1::tuple<cocos2d::network::HttpClient*>&, std::__1::__tuple_indices<0ul>, std::__1::tuple<>&&) + 40 at functional:2060
     [29] 0x000000010ed20f3a MyProject`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> > >(void*) [inlined] std::__1::__bind_return<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), std::__1::tuple<cocos2d::network::HttpClient*>, std::__1::tuple<>, _is_valid_bind_return<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), std::__1::tuple<cocos2d::network::HttpClient*>, std::__1::tuple<> >::value>::type std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*>::operator()<>() + 38 at functional:2123
     [30] 0x000000010ed20f14 MyProject`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> > >(void*) [inlined] decltype(std::__1::forward<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> >(fp)(std::__1::forward<>(fp0))) std::__1::__invoke<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> >(std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*>&&) + 11 at __functional_base:415
     [31] 0x000000010ed20f09 MyProject`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> > >(void*) [inlined] void std::__1::__thread_execute<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> >(std::__1::tuple<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> >&, std::__1::__tuple_indices<>) + 25 at thread:337
     [32] 0x000000010ed20ef0 MyProject`void* std::__1::__thread_proxy<std::__1::tuple<std::__1::__bind<void (cocos2d::network::HttpClient::*)(), cocos2d::network::HttpClient*> > >(void*) + 368 at thread:347
     [33] 0x00000001176a305a libsystem_pthread.dylib`_pthread_body + 131
     [34] 0x00000001176a2fd7 libsystem_pthread.dylib`_pthread_body
     [35] 0x00000001176a03ed libsystem_pthread.dylib`thread_start + 13
[36] 0x1d5ebc001
```

It turns out that this is caused by bad memory management in HttpAsynConnection-apple.m.

Since we have fixed this on our project, a fix PR will be made soon.

data.title: [AssetManagerEx] Stuck if the last download task fails
data.body:
Due to a bug in AssetManagerEx, if the last download task fails, the AssetManager will not end its `UPDATING` state causing the download process to hang forever. 

As we have fixed it in our project, a fix PR will be made soon.

data.title: v3.11 updated expiration dates of all winrt test app and template certificates
data.body:
This pull requests fixes the expiring app certificates for all of the winrt projects and templates.

@minggo Please pull this request before v3.11 ships as some of the certs expired yesterday.

data.title: Fixed crash and actions may not have been executed.
[FileUtils] memory leak when read emty file.
[FileUtils] Should not support text mode.
data.body:
We are current using `"rt"` to open files:
1. https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.cpp#L627
2. https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/platform/android/CCFileUtils-android.cpp#L297

For 1, it works only on Windows.
For 2, it is already android, `"rt"` has not effect here.

And as cocos2d-x it is a cross platform game engine, what's the point of supporting `rt` on Windows?

Eg, for a user works on windows developing mobile game for android. The resource files has text with CRLF.
It may works on windows. When user release the game to android (and iOS), the code may not work with the resources any more...

data.title: v3.11 update config.json version to v3-deps-91
data.body: This PR updates config.json version to v3-deps-91. This will add the updated winrt chipmunk libs from PR https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin/pull/216 and fixes issue https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin/pull/206#issuecomment-202660479.

data.title: Update CCSprite3D.cpp
data.body: Fixed Sprite3DCache::removeSprite3DData error

data.title: Add missing dllexport to avoid warning C4275
data.body:
Hello, I get the following warnings [C4275](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/3tdb471s.aspx) when building `cocos2d-win32.sln` and `cocos2d-win8.1-universal.sln` with Visual Studio 2015:

```
cocos\editor-support/cocostudio/LocalizationManager.h(28): warning C4275: non dll-interface class 'cocostudio::ILocalizationManager' used as base for dll-interface class 'cocostudio::JsonLocalizationManager'
cocos\editor-support/cocostudio/LocalizationManager.h(56): warning C4275: non dll-interface class 'cocostudio::ILocalizationManager' used as base for dll-interface class 'cocostudio::BinLocalizationManager'
```

This pull request adds `CC_STUDIO_DLL` macro as a prefix to `ILocalizationManager` and fixes that.

data.title: Implement createDirectory for apple platform.
data.body:
Fixes #15073.
I think using of file manger for creating directories is more suitable for apple platforms.

data.title: Replace cc_utf8_to_utf16 with UTF8ToUTF16 to avoid deprecation warning
data.body:
This pull request fixes the following warning when building JS Bindings with Xcode 7.3:

```
cocos/scripting/js-bindings/manual/js_manual_conversions.cpp:2079:39: 'cc_utf8_to_utf16' is deprecated
```

data.title: Android: Warning about -Wno-extern-c-compat
data.body:
Android flag `-Wno-extern-c-compat` added at:
- https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/Android.mk#L280
- https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/Android.mk#L282
- https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/platform/android/Android.mk#L36
- https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cocos/platform/android/Android.mk#L38

cause a lot of warnings:

> cc1plus: warning: unrecognized command line option "-Wno-extern-c-compat"

Is `-Wno-extern-c-compat` an old flag for old compilers? Is it safe to remove it?

data.title: Fixes deprecated warnings
data.body:
- remove all internal use of FileUtils::getFileData().

---

BTW: It seems we needs a method to get whole file content form files as string (allow the returning string have '\0' in it).

How about:

``` C++
std:string FileUtils::getContent(const std::string& filename, bool binary);
```

data.title: Use decltype and std::remove_pointer to avoid side effect warnings.
